painPoints.title: Revenue Recognition Complexity
painPoints.summary: 4 financing platforms + deposits + payment timing = P&L is probably fiction
painPoints.opener: I noticed you're running 4 different financing platforms - CareCredit, PatientFi, Alphaeon, and Cherry. That's a lot of reconciliation.
painPoints.question: What's your biggest headache with that setup?

painPoints.title: Unknown Procedure Margins
painPoints.summary: BBL is the bread and butter but true cost is probably unknown
painPoints.opener: BBL is clearly your signature procedure. Most practices we work with don't actually know their true margin per procedure once you factor in OR time, supplies, nursing hours, and revision risk.
painPoints.question: Do you have visibility into your per-procedure profitability?

painPoints.title: Infrastructure Gap
painPoints.summary: 23 employees, accredited surgery center, no finance person visible
painPoints.opener: You've grown to 23 people with an AAHC-accredited surgery center. That's real scale. But I didn't see a CFO or controller on your team.
painPoints.question: How are you handling the finance function right now?
options: It's a bit of a mess

botContext.systemPromptAdditions: You are speaking with someone from Premiere Surgical Arts, a cosmetic surgery practice in Houston. They have about 23 employees, do high-ticket procedures (especially BBLs), and use 4 different patient financing platforms. They don't have a dedicated finance person. You don't know who exactly you're speaking with - it could be the owner, office manager, or someone else. Don't assume their role. Reference these business specifics naturally in conversation. Your goal is to surface their pain points around financial visibility and guide them toward booking a diagnostic call.
knownFacts: They accept CareCredit, PatientFi, Alphaeon, and Cherry Financing
Balance is due 14 days before surgery
They posted for an RN in June 2025
No cash accepted, cards only in-office

cta.headline: Your 30-Minute Financial Diagnostic
cta.subhead: We found this in public data. Imagine what we'd find with your actual books.
